## CES-D vs SF-36

CES-D vs SF-36 Researchers, psychologists, and social scientists often find themselves in a situation where they need to compare different items from different questionnaire instruments. For those working in the field of mental health, comparing CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale) and SF-36 (36-item Short Form Health Survey) is a common scenario. The CES-D vs SF-36 comparison is essential to understand how scores align or differ across dimensions such as mental health impairment, mental health, and social functioning. But, this comparison is usually time-consuming and requires expertise. # Essential Tool for Comparison Here's where the Harmony software comes in handy! With the power of AI and natural language processing, Harmony makes it a breeze to harmonise questionnaire items. It simplifies the CES-D vs SF-36 comparison by giving a percentage match between each item in both questionnaires. The intuitive and user-friendly web interface allows you to select the questionnaires from its database or upload your own PDF files for comparison. Even more impressive, Harmony can perform these comparisons across multiple languages! # Why use Harmony for CES-D vs SF-36 comparison By using Harmony for CES-D vs SF-36 comparisons, researchers can save valuable time and focus more on the analysis and interpretation of results. The ability to ensure consistent matching of items across these two popular instruments can increase the reliability and validity of longitudinal and cross-study comparisons. So, whether you're studying depressive symptoms, mental health problems, or the social functioning of your respondents - remember CES-D vs SF-36 comparison is just a few clicks away with Harmony!

## Compare the items in CES-D English and SF-36

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#__" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and SF-36 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#__" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#__" target="harmonyapp">Import just SF-36 into Harmony</a> - compare SF-36 with other instruments
